discussion.content:
A is correct per Oracle doc, "The UGA must be available to a database session for the life of the session. For this reason, the UGA cannot be stored in the PGA when using a shared server connection because the PGA is specific to a single process. Therefore, the UGA is stored in the SGA when using shared server connections, enabling any shared server process access to it. When using a dedicated server connection, the UGA is stored in the PGA."

https://docs.oracle.com/database/121/CNCPT/memory.htm#CNCPT803
